title: Inside the historic renovations of the Georgia Capitol Building
summary:
Overview:
The transcript details the extensive renovations being made to the Georgia State Capitol building, focusing on the restoration work in the House and Senate chambers. The renovations aim to preserve the historic architecture and infrastructure while modernizing key systems like HVAC, electricity, and accessibility.

Key Actions:
No specific bills or legislation mentioned.

Bills Introduced (First Reading):
None detected.

Notable Moments:
- Detailed descriptions of the painstaking restoration work, including replastering, new HVAC systems, over 76,000 feet of new cabling, and the meticulous repainting and gilding by specialized artisan painters.
- Mention of previous renovations under former House Speaker Tom Murphy that had to "cut corners" due to time constraints.
- Emphasis on the sense of pride and ownership the Georgia-based contractors, architects, and craftspeople feel in restoring this historic state landmark.

Votes:
None detected.

Attendance:
No quorum notes provided.

Adjournment:
No specific adjournment or next session date mentioned.
